title: Question 21
prompt: Conservation of energy is an example of
description:
Click the one best answer to each question.

Conservation of Energy: As a roller coaster car gains height, it loses speed. Kinetic energy is converted into potential energy. The sum of potential energy and kinetic energy is constant. However, this model is somewhat simplified, since friction removes a certain amount of kinetic energy from the system.
feedback: A law of physics is a theory that applies universally to all material systems—that is, it is always true, under any circumstance—and has been extensively tested and found true. In 1837, Karl Friedrich Mohr wrote one of the earliest general statements describing conservation of energy. This idea has been refined and tested over more than 150 years.
